text: Matthew Hall (born April 24, 1990) is a former American football tackle. He played college football for Belhaven University and signed with the Minnesota Vikings as an undrafted free agent on May 10, 2014. Hall was released on July 25 and signed with the Colts on July 27. He was waived with a triceps tear on August 30, and reverted to their injured reserve after going unclaimed. Hall was waived by the Colts on May 4, 2015. On August 10, 2015 Hall was claimed off of waivers by the Denver Broncos, but elected to retire rather than report to the team. Hall is now in the Arkansas Law Enforcement Training Academy in the class of 2020-C and is the Squad Leader of the B Squad. ==References== ==External links== * Indianapolis Colts bio * Belhaven Blazers bio Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:Belhaven Blazers football players Category:American football tackles Category:Minnesota Vikings players Category:Indianapolis Colts players Category:People from Yell County, Arkansas
title: Matt Hall (American football)
